availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Carner (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Son of John J. Carner and Mary Carner. Married to Martha A. Tosh Carner in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on September 28, 1865. Student in Caldwell County in 1850. Farm laborer in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 26, 1863, to December 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 289B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 137-8.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #001929335.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0444.
